Jocelyn has a stall that sells fish.  She has had this business for six years.  She has requested a loan of PHP 7000 to purchase more fish to sell.
Jocelyn has been a member of PMPC for one year. In the future, Jocelyn hopes to build an additional stall for her fish-vending business.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell

loans.name: Josepher

texts.en:
Josepher is 31 years old and lives in Dela Paz, Panaon, Misamis Occidental. He is single and has no dependents. 
Josepher has a motor cab for hire business and earns approximately PHP 9,000 each month doing this type of work. He has a requested a loan of PHP 28,000 to purchase materials for his motorcycle's repair. 
Josepher has been a member of PMPC for one year. In the future,  Josepher hopes to buy another motor cab.

loans.use: to purchase materials for his motorcycle's repair

loans.name: Juanita's Group

texts.en:
Juanita is married with five children. She is 62 years old and lives in Butuay, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental.
To earn a living, Juanita has a coconut and copra buying business. She has had this business for eight years. Each month, she earns approximately PHP 9,000. Juanita has been a member of PMPC for eight years.
In the future, Juanita hopes to expand her business. Juanita is the leader of a three person group. Although they borrow as a group, each member of the group has their own business.

loans.use: to purchase more coconuts and copra for her retail business

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita is from Sapang Dalaga, Misamis Occidental. She is 53 years old. Anita is married and has three children. 

To make a living, Anita owns and operates a business venture, making and selling a variety of snack goods in the local community. Anita has been engaged in her business for three years and earns approximately PHP 1,300 a month for these activities.

Anita is requesting a loan of PHP 3,400, which will be used to purchase additional snack items to sell. In 2009, Anita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional snack items to sell

loans.name: Emelin Morena

texts.es: Emelin, originaria de  León, de oficio comerciante  dueña de una pulpería, la cual ha venido creciendo poco a poco gracias al apoyo recibido  por medio del préstamo Kiva que fue de mucha importancia pues el primer préstamo lo utilizo para compra de granos básico s, aceite , azúcar , maíz, trigo esto le sirvió para variar y surtir su mercadería y mejorar los ingresos. Ahora requiere un segundo crédito para compra de arroz, frijoles, azúcar, aceite, maíz, trigo, concentrado para mascotas, huevo, leche. Siempre con el objetivo de variar y mantener productos de mucha utilidad y necesidad para sus clientes. Ella tiene como meta ahorrar y comprar una camioneta para utilizar como vehículo de transporte para la mercadería que vende.
texts.en: Emelin is from León. She is the owner of a small grocery store, which has been growing bit by bit thanks to the support she has received in the form of the Kiva loan, which was very important. She used her first loan to buy basic grains, cooking oil, sugar, corn, and wheat. This helped her to vary and stock her merchandise and improve her income. She now needs a second loan to buy rice, beans, sugar, cooking oil, corn, wheat, pet food, eggs, and milk so that she can add variety and always have products that are useful and necessary for her customers. Her goal is to save and buy a truck to use for transportation for the merchandise that she sells.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, sugar, cooking oil, corn, wheat, pet food, eggs, and milk.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay his children’s study fees.

loans.name: Constance

texts.en:
Constance is 21 years old. She would like to be in college and do what people her age do, but she can’t because she did not have the money to pay college tuition. Constance has not given up hope of ever going to college. She has started a business as a mobile money transfer agent in her home city of Chingola in the Copperbelt Province of Zambia.

Constance’s biggest dream is to expand her business beyond her home town. She intends to be able to handle huge sums of money as this will enable her to have more profits. However, Constance faces the challenge of having little capital for her business. This means that she cannot conduct transfers that require large sums of money to be received or sent. When she gets the loan, she intends to increase her working capital so that she will be able to handle bigger transfers of money. When she has grown her business, Constance wants to go to college while continuing to run her business.

Constance is convinced that her business is helping her community because many do not know how to read and write and her money transfers do not require complicated paperwork. Also, she provides personalized services so her customers always get all the help they need. This, she believes, is the competitive edge that her business has that will help make enough profits to realize her dream of going to college 

In this Video, Constance is being interviewed by a representative from Mobile Transactions.

loans.use: To increase her working capital so that she can handle bigger transfers of money

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her husband Jamal appears in her Kiva profile photo, photographed next to the taxi he owns.

Mariam is 37 years old, and a mother with two sons and five daughters. Her husband employed, but does not enough to cover the family's needs. For the past two years, Mariam's husband has also been driving a taxi, which has been a profitable project.

Mariam is requesting a loan from FATEN to help her husband cover the costs of making some necessary repairs to the taxi such as painting, changing the engine, etc., in order to improve the taxi's condition. This will increase the taxi's efficiency and ability to take more requests, which will improve the family's income.

About this loan product:

FATEN offers loans that are customized for Muslim borrowers. A key principle of Islam is the prohibition of charging interest on a loan. This prohibition is based on the belief that money is only a medium of exchange and has no value in itself. In order to offer loans in a manner that is consistent with borrowers' values, FATEN charges 0 percent interest on this loan. However, FATEN does charge a servicing fee to cover its costs. The loan amount you see listed on Kiva includes both the principal loan and the loan servicing fees. As with all Kiva loans, you should expect to have your funds returned to you according to this loan’s repayment schedule. For more information on lending in the Muslim world, please click here.

loans.use: to make necessary repairs to the taxi.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase added vegetables for his shop.

loans.name: Beth

texts.en:
Beth is 38 years old, married to Mwangi, and together are blessed with four children, ages 16, 13, 10, and 4 years old.

Beth runs a clothes-selling business in Kayole, Nairobi. She has been in this business for the last four years and gets a monthly income of KES 5,000. Beth is applying for her first loan term of KES 20,000 with KADET LTD, with which she plans to buy clothes to stock up her business.

Beth hopes to educate her children, to build a home and to open a boutique.

loans.use: to add more stock of clothes for sale.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is 43 years old, a mixed crop farmer who is married to Joyce, a fellow farmer. They are blessed with a child. He has been in the farming business for the past three years with a monthly income of KES 10,000 which he uses to support his family.

He is applying for his first loan term with KADET LTD after being introduced by an existing KADET customer. John will use the loan to buy seedlings and fertilizer for his farm.

With the anticipated profit from the business, he will educate his child. His hopes and dreams are to venture into pig rearing, which will help him improve the living standard of his family.

loans.use: to buy seedlings and fertilizer for his farm.

loans.name: Demetrio

texts.es:
Demetrio, de 36 años de edad, es un hombre amable y cordial con muchas ganas de progresar. Es soltero, vive  solo en la casa que le dejo sus padres como herencia, y que ahora lo comparte con su hermano. La actividad que realiza Demetrio es el alquiler de equipos de sonido, que los compró hace 8 años con un préstamo familiar. Es así que se dedica al alquiler de éstos equipos, por lo que lleva más de 02 años en actividad. Asimismo manifiesta que en este trabajo cuenta la ayuda de un animador y otro persona que se encarga de cargar los equipos, a ambos le paga por contrato o servicio realizado.
Le gusta su actividad por el ingreso económico que le genera, logrando hacerse conocido en los eventos sociales que participa, además de contar con un mototaxi con el cual se genera un ingreso económico adicional, ya que al no poder ejercer la docencia, tuvo que buscarse este oficio que aprendió trabajando con disjockey en una discoteca en la ciudad de Lima. Ahora con las ganancias que percibe, tiene planes de ampliar su negocio y comprarse equipos de sonidos modernos. Este será el préstamo número 02 con la institución MFP, por tanto espera de un pequeño préstamo para que pueda cumplir con sus objetivos. Por otro lado, comenta sentirse a gusto con banco comunal pues lo considera un grupo responsable. Con el monto solicitado de 800 nuevos soles lo invertirá en el mantenimiento de equipos de sonido, y con el saldo comprará más parlantes.
texts.en:
36-year-old Demetrio is a kind and friendly man who is very eager to progress. He is single and lives in the house left to him parents as inheritance, which he now he shares with his brother. Demetrio rents out audio equipment, which he bought 8 years ago with a family loan. He has had this business for over 2 years. He also tells us that his work requires the assistance of an entertainer and a person responsible for loading the equipment, and he pays them both per contract or service performed.

Demetrio likes his work because of income it generates, and because it makes him well known in the social events that he is involved in. He also has a motorcycle taxi which provides an additional income. As he could not find a teacher, Demetrio learned his trade by working with a DJ in a nightclub in the city of Lima. 

With the profits he earns, Demetrio has plans to expand his business and buy modern sound equipment. This will be his second loan with MFP, and he hopes for a small loan so that he can meet his goals. He says that he feels comfortable with the communal bank and consideres them a responsible group. With the requested amount of 800 soles, Demetrio will invest in the maintenance of sound equipment, and with the remaining amount he will buy more speakers.

loans.use: to maintain his audio equipment and purchase more speakers

loans.name: Adela

texts.es:
La señora Adela solicita el préstamo para invertir en mercancía ya que desea tener mayor variedad de productos que ofrecer a sus clientes, ya que solo cuenta con ropa de niño y desea tener ropa para toda la familia ya que sus clientes se lo están solicitando y así podrá tener mas ingreso a su negocio. 
Doña Adela cuenta con varios años de dictándose al comercio y a la venta de ropa usada y nueva, también tiene el ingreso de su esposo el señor Humberto quien trabaja en una empresa aduanara, entre los dos de darle lo mejor a sus dos hijos y que tengo lo necesario para salir adelante.
texts.en:
Adela is seeking a loan to invest in more merchandise, as she wants a wider variety of products to offer to her customers. At the moment, she only stocks children's clothes and she wants to sell clothing for the whole family. She has received requests from her clients, and thus she may be able to increase her income from her business. 

Adela has several years experience of running a business and selling both new and second-hand clothes. She also has the income from her husband, Humberto, who works as a customs officer. Between them, they try to give the best for their two children and make sure they have what they need to succeed.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise for her business

loans.name: Dickson

texts.en:
Dickson is 33 years old and married with one child. 

He does tailoring to earn a living. He has been in the business for five years and describes his business environment as good because there is limited competition. 

Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has been able to improve his living standards and hopes to expand his business in the future. He has applied for 15,000 Kenya Shillings to buy a sewing machine.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Fredrick

texts.en:
Fredrick is 26 years old and single. 

He sells second hand clothes, as well as owning a motorbike. He gets a monthly income of KES 8,400 from his business. He has been in this business for the past seven years.

This is his first loan term from KADET LTD. He will use the loan term to purchase more clothes for resale in his business. He was brought to KADET LTD  by a member of staff.

His dream is to expand his business and sell new clothes wholesale.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of clothes for sale.

loans.name: Amal

texts.en:
Amal is a conservative person, who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her husband appears in her Kiva profile photo. 

Amal is a 33-year-old young woman. She is a mother with two sons and two daughters. Her husband is employed, but doesn't earn enough to cover the family's needs.

Amal is requesting a 1,500 USD loan from FATEN, to help her cover the costs of installing wooden shelves for the kitchen. This will offer Amal better space to use in the kitchen and improve the look of the house.

loans.use: To install wooden shelves for the kitchen

loans.name: Johnny

texts.en:
Johny paid off the previous loan well and in good time and has applied for his second loan from KADET LTD to enable him buy maize seeds and fertilizers for his farm.

He hopes to expand his business and give a good education to his children.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Toktokhan

texts.ru: Токтохан 56 лет, замужем, имеет четверых детей. Токтохан работает врачом в Карабууринсой автостанции, но в связи с нехваткой людей в селе, она по совместительству работает  кассиром. С 2007 года, в поисках дополнительного источника дохода для своей семьи, Токтохан начала свой бизнес в животноводстве и полеводстве со стартовой суммы в 30,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорству и настойчивости, на сегодняшний день,  ее хозяйство насчитывает одну дойную корову и двадцать овец, и  приносит около 10,000 сом (KGS) в месяц от продажи молочных и мясных продуктов. Также Токтохан обрабатывает 3 га земли, где выращивает фасоль.  В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Токтохан обратилась в компанию «Бай-Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку дополнительных голов скота и закуп минеральных удобрений . В будущем, Токтохан хочет увеличить хозяйство и расширить свой бизнес.
texts.en: Toktokhan is 56 years old, married, and has four children.  She works as a medic in a bus station of the Kara-Buura district, but due to a shortage of people in the village, she holds another job as a cashier.  Since 2007, in search of an additional source of income for her family, Toktokhan started her own business in animal-husbandry and farming with a starting sum of 30,000 som (KGS).  Thanks to her tenacity and persistance, her business now consists of one dairy cow and twenty sheep and brings about 10,000 som (KGS) per month from the sale of dairy and meat products.  Toktokhan also cultivates beans on 3 hectares of land.  In order to further develop her business, Toktokhan has turned to "Bai Tushum & Partners", for a loan in the amount of 50,000 som (KGS).  This loan will allow her to purchase additional livestock and mineral fertilizers.  In the future, she wants to increase her farming activity and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase livestock and fertilizers.

loans.name: Cindy

texts.es: Cindy, de 27 años, es una mujer buena y amable, es conviviente con Francisco de 31 años con quien tiene una pequeña hija, Mayte de 4 años a quien desea brindarle una buena calidad de vida, ella vive en una casa propia a lado de su familia brindándose protección entre si. A diario Cindy se dirige a la casa de los amigos, vecinos y familiares, para venderles prendas de vestir, especificamente ropa para niños. Su metodo de negocio es dejar a crédito la mercadería y al cabo de un tiempo realiza las cobranzas, del mismo modo también vende al contado. Las prendas que tiene son de diferentes modelos y variados colores. Lleva realizando su trabajo por dos años, y hasta el momento lo ha hecho sola. Le gusta mucho su trabajo ya que le permite tener tiempo para poder cuidar de sus hijos, al mismo tiempo que sus ganancias las deriva para los gastos del hogar. Ahora lo que prioriza es ampliar su negocio vendiendo calzados para niños. Este será el primer crédito con MFP, esta a la expectativa de que le brinden un apoyo para así poder seguir haciendo su trabajo y cumplir con sus metas, por otro lado se compromete a ser una cliente puntual ya que tiene muy buenas referencias del grupo al que se esta incorporando por que son muy responsables y solidarios. Con el monto solicitado 800 soles, comprará mercadería para seguir vendiendo a sus clientes ya que desea tener mayor variedad y cantidad que ofrecer.
texts.en:
Cindy, 27, is an amiable and good-natured woman.  She lives with Francisco, 31, with whom she has a little daughter, Mayte, who is four.  She wants to offer her a good standard of living.  Cindy lives in her own house alongside her family, who take care of each other.  Every day, Cindy visits the homes of her friends, neighbors, and relatives to sell them clothing, especially clothes for kids. Her business method is to leave the merchandise on credit and then charge her clients after a certain period of time; she also sells in installments.  She has outfits of different models and colors.  She has been doing this work for two years, and to date, she has always worked on her own.  She really likes her work, since it gives her time to take care of her child, as well as giving her money towards the housekeeping.  At the moment, she is making selling children's shoes her priority.

This will be her first loan with Kiva partner MFP.  She is hoping to get the support she needs to carry on her work and to meet her goals.  She promises to pay punctually, and she has very good references from the group of which she is a member, who are very responsible and good comrades.  With the 800 soles ($300) she is seeking, she will buy merchandise to sell to her clients, who want more variety and more clothing than she can currently offer them.

loans.use: to buy more children's clothing.

loans.name: Ingri Janette

texts.es: Ingrid, de 34 años de edad, casada, habitante de la ciudad de León, de oficio comerciante,  ella vende gaseosas por cajillas. Ella inicio con este negocio hace 1 año ha sido su primer negocio su esposo la ha apoyado desde el principio. Ella realizo el crédito para comprar 100 cajillas de gaseosas para vender ya que tiene   un pedido el cual no quiere perder.  Ella tiene como meta crecer y hacer más sostenible su negocio  para mejorar su condición de vida.
texts.en: Ingrid is 34 years old. She is married and lives in the city of León. She is a merchant, selling soft drinks by the case. She started this business 1 year ago, her first business. Her husband has supported her from the beginning. She took out this loan to buy 100 cases of soft drinks to sell, since she has an order she doesn't want to lose. Her goal is to grow and make her business more sustainable to improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy 100 cases of soft drinks.

loans.name: Marta Sofía

texts.es: Marta Sofía de de edad , posee una ladrillera cerca del lugar de su residencia, es muy conocida en la zona pues su producto es de muy buena calidad y lo vende a precios muy accesibles, se ha hecho de mucha clientela ya que siempre encuentran lo que necesitan; Marta es una mujer entregada a su trabajo, muy activa siempre dispuesta a cumplir todos sus propósitos, piensa que cuando se desea algo y se desea llegar al éxito, se debe correr riesgos, pero al final la felicidad vale la pena,  quiere tener esa felicidad  por eso quiere ver crecer su negocio es asi como se decidio a solicitarle a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar barro, arcilla y otra materia prima. Marta Sofía tiene la confianza que así podrá llevar a su hogar una mejor situación económica.
texts.en: Marta Sofía has a brick making business close to her residence. She is well known in the area because her product is of good quality and she sells it very accessible prices. She has gained many customers because they always find what they need. Marta is dedicated to her work and very active. She is always willing to come through with anything. She thinks that when you want something and you want to be successful, you have to take risks, but at the end it's worth it. She wants to have that happiness and that's why she wants to see her business grow and that's why she decided to ask INTEGRAL for a loan that will allow hr to buy mud, clay and other raw materials. Marta Sofía is sure that this way she can bring her home to a better financial situation.

loans.use: to buy mud and clay.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es: Margarita es una emprendedora que tiene 49 años de edad, su actividad a la que se dedica es a la venta de mercadería en general, esta actividad la realiza de forma ambulante ya tiene sus clientes que le ofrece su productos. Ella inicio este negocio con el objetivo de apoyarlo a su esposo en los gastos del hogar y sacar a su hijo adelante brindándole lo mejor. Margarita actualmente esta financiamiento para invertir en el negocio en la compra de blusas, pantalones,  camisas, cosméticos, sandalias, short, entre otros productos que mas demandan.
texts.en: Margarita is a 49-year-old entrepreneur whose business is selling general merchandise.  She makes her sales as an itinerant vendor and already has customers to whom she offers her products.  She started this business with the aim of supporting her husband with the household expenses and providing for her son, giving him the best.  Margarita is requesting this loan to invest in her business by purchasing blouses, pants, shirts, cosmetics, sandals, shorts and other products that people request the most.

loans.use: to buy blouses, pants, shirts, cosmetics, sandals, shorts and other products that people request the most

loans.name: Jameela

texts.en:
Jameela is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her husband appears in her Kiva profile photo taken in the FATEN Branch. 

Jameela is a 50 year old woman. She is the mother of two sons and one daughter. Her husband is a salaried worker, but not enough to cover the family's needs.

Jameela is requesting a 2,000 USD loan from FATEN to help her cover the costs of purchasing new home furniture such as bedroom furniture, living room seats and dinning room furniture. This will improve the family's home living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase home furniture.

loans.name: Daylinda

texts.en: Daylinda is from Northern Pob., Calamba, Misamis Occidental. She is 62 years old. Daylinda is married and has 4 children. To make a living, Daylinda plants, harvests and sell bananas. Daylinda has been engaged in her business for 15 years and earns approximately 1,000 PHP a month for these activities. In 2009, Daylinda joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Daylinda is requesting a new loan of 3,800 PHP which will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise

loans.name: Elvis Benjamín

texts.es: Elvis Benjamín de treinta y uno años de edad vive con su compañera de vida y su hija en casa propia. El posee una panadería en el lugar de su residencia, desde hace algún tiempo, se ha hecho de mucha clientela pues vende de todo tipo de pan, con material de excelente calidad a precios realmente accesibles, además el servicio es muy bueno Elvis siempre recibe su clientela con el mejor de los gustos; él es un hombre dedicado a su labor trata de aprovechar todas las oportunidades que se le presentan, piensa que la vida es un sueño y está dispuesto a alcanzarlo, quiere ver crecer el negocio y mantenerse adelante de su competencia es por eso que se decidió a solicitarle a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar harina por mayor, levadura, azúcar, utensilios entre otros. Elvis Benjamín tiene la esperanza de que así podrá darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: 31-year-old Elvis Benjamín lives with his life partner and daughter in his own home.  He has had a bakery in his home for some time.  He has gained a lot of customers as he sells all types of bread which he makes from top-quality materials and sells at really affordable prices.  In addition, the service he provides is very good.  Elvis always receives his customers with the best of tastes.  He is a man who is committed to his work.  He tries to make the most of all opportunities which present themselves.  He believes that life is a dream and he is ready to reach it.  He would like to see his business grow and keep ahead of the competition.  For this reason, he decided to request a loan from INTEGRAL which will allow him to buy flour wholesale, yeast, sugar, utensils and other products.  Elvis Benjamín hopes that this will enable him to provide his family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy flour, yeast, sugar and utensils

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira is from Baliangao, Misamis Occidental. She is 44 years old and married. 

To make a living, Elvira owns and operates a banana plantation. She has been in her business for 3 years and earns 2,000 PHP a month for these activities. 

Last year, Elvira joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has requested a new loan of 5,200 PHP which will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to finance her family's needs.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise

loans.name: Loreta

texts.en:
Loreta is from Calamba, Misamis Occidental. She is married and 41 years old.

To make a living, Loreta plants, harvests and sells bananas. Loreta has been in her business for three years and earns approximately 1,200 PHP a month for these activities. 

In 2010, Loreta joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Loreta is requesting a new loan of 3,800 PHP which will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise.

loans.name: Anelyn

texts.en: Anelyn is from Bunawan, Calamba, Misamis Occidental. She is 26 years old. Anelyn is married and has one infant child. To make a living, she owns and operates a banana/coconut plantation. She has been in her business for five years and earns 850 PHP a month from these activities. In 2010, Anelyn joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Anelyn is requesting a new loan of 1,650 PHP which again will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of the family.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise

loans.name: Linda

texts.en:
This is Linda, 51, a resident of GMA, Cavite City, Philippines. She is married to Rolando, a cook, and has children. Together with her husband and children, Linda manages their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.

Linda operates a coin bank manufacturing business. She buys raw materials used in coin bank production and processes it into colorful coin banks. Her finished products are distributed to markets, general stores and other places where she has contacts for her products. She earns a small margin for every coin bank that she delivers. Aside from this, she also operates an internet shop for additional income. She earns a minimum of 1500 PHP in profit every day.

To help her continue operation of her business, she is requesting a 50,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy raw materials needed in coin bank production and other supplies for her business. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Linda dreams of being able to give her all her children a good, high quality education through all her hard work on her business, and she also hopes to tap more customers in the future. She faithfully meets up with her fellowship co-members to share stories of her work every week, and also draws strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for supplies and materials needed in her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more shoes for the upcoming season.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
This is Erlinda, 38, a resident of GMA, Cavite, Philippines. She is a single parent with one child.  She manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.                             

Erlinda operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. She also operates a small barber shop for additional income. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 500 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 20,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Erlinda hopes to be able to expand soon, just as she dreams to be able to give her family a good future through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Rizalina

texts.en:
Rizalina is 57 years old and a widow with 3 children. She lives in Mahayahay, Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur: Philippines. She owns and operates a business venture, selling a variety of vegetables to earn a living and she's been 5 years in this business. Each month, she earns approximately 5,000 PHP doing this type of business. 

She requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase additional vegetables to sell. In 2009, Rizalina joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Positively, she simply hopes for the business to improve.

loans.use: to purchase additional vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Hegenio

texts.en:
Hegenio is married with 4 children. He is 42 years old and lives in Lacapp, Acad Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines.

He is operating a general store, selling a variety of products to local community members to earn a living. He has been doing this for 5 years and every month he earns about 3,500 PHP from this work. He has requested a loan of 8,000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell.

In 2009, Hegenio joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his business and living situation. He hopes to improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell.

location.town: Lacapp, Acad Aurora, Zamboanga del sur

loans.name: Ganzorig

texts.en:
Ganzorig, 38, runs a freight transportation business. He lives with his family in the ger district (ger is a Mongolian traditional nomadic tent) in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He started his business in 1992 and carries heavy luggage and things between cities or regions. His truck is the main tool for his business and he always takes care of its wholeness and safety. 

Now he wants to start his second business in used cars sales in the auto bazaar. He is planning to purchase and collect his used cars from private persons around the city. Then he will make some necessary repairs or adjustments to them. Therefore, he needs some money for the costs of the starting and adjustments of his new business. He will use his loan to purchase some old cars for creating his new business working capital. Let’s support him to start his new business.

loans.use: To purchase some old cars for creating his new business working capital.

loans.name: Ana

texts.en: Ana is 37 years old, married, and has 3 children who are in school. She is in the agricultural business of buying and selling livestock in the Philippines. She has been buying and selling livestock for 3 years now, and has borrowed 3 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it. She requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to buy more livestock for her business. In the future, Ana would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more livestock for her business.

loans.name: Warlita

texts.en:
Warlita is from Aurora, Zamboanga Del Sur, Philippines. She is 50 years old, married, and has 2 dependents. She used her last loan to purchase daily use commodities to sell, such as canned goods, spices, shampoo and more. Her business has grown up and become successful. 

Now, she's taking a new loan which will be used in another type of business, to repair a transport vehicle used in the business. Positively, she hopes to be able to grow her business.

loans.use: To repair a transport vehicle used in the business.

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
Analyn is 45 years old and married with 4 children. She earns a living by farming vegetables in the Philippines. She has been farming vegetables for 7 years and also earns additional income from a sari-sari (variety) store.

Analyn is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Memia

texts.en:
Memia is from Bobongan, Ramon Magsaysay, Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 41 years old, married, and has 5 children. 

To make a living, Memia owns & operates a manufacturing business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from manufacturing & selling products to local businesses and community members. She has been in her business for 6 years and earns about 5,000 PHP a month for these activities. 

In 2009, Memia joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional raw materials to expand her product offerings. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional raw materials to expand her product offerings.

location.town: Bobongan, Ramon Magsaysay, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Belsi

texts.es:
Belsi  tiene 47 años de edad, es madre soltera y tiene 2 hijos de 18 y 22 años de edad, vive con sus hijos en la aldea Ceguaca de Santa Barbará. 
Belsi,  tiene su negocio de pulpería el cual estableció con su propio capital hace 8 años, y vende productos de la canasta básica como frijoles, arroz, harina, manteca, café, cal, pan ,lácteos, churros, refrescos, agua en bolsa  y panas plásticas. Su negocio tiene bastante movimiento ya que esta ubicado en una zona de mucha afluencia de personas, y las ventas que obtiene le generan buenas ganancias. Ella atiende su negocio todo el día.
Ha logrado mantener surtido su negocio con la ayuda de varios préstamos obtenidos, y ahora solicita su tercer préstamo para poder abastecerse de producto como azúcar, manteca, frijoles, arroz, frescos, pan, lácteos, café, churros, confites y maseca.
Doña Belsi pertenece a un grupo solidario de ODEF, Los Ángeles de Ceguaca, el cual esta formado por 2 miembros y quienes han solicitado 10,000 lempiras cada uno. 
Su plan en el futuro es tener un mejor local y ampliar más su negocio.
texts.en:
Belsi, age 47, is a single mother, and she has two children, ages 18 and 22.  She lives with her children in the village of Ceguaca de Santa Barbará.

Belsi has a grocery store business, which she established with her own money eight years ago.  She sells staples like beans, rice, flour, lard, coffee, lime, bread, dairy products, churros, soft drinks, water in bags, and plastic containers.  Her business has plenty of movement because it is located in an area with a lot of people.  The sales that she gets generate good income for her.  She takes care of her store all day.

She has managed to keep her business stocked with the help of various loans she has received.  She is now requesting her third loan in order to be able to stock up on products like sugar, lard, beans, rice, soft drinks, bread, dairy products, coffee, sweets, and “maseca” (instant corn dough).

Belsi is a member of the Los Ángeles de Ceguaca communal bank with ODEF.  The group is comprised of two members, who have requested 10,000 lempiras each.  

Her plan for the future is to have a better place and to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy products like sugar, lard, beans, rice, soft drinks, bread, dairy products, coffee, sweets, and “maseca” (instant corn dough).

loans.name: Enkhbold

texts.en:
Enkhbold operates passenger transportation around the districts of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia, using his minivan. Since 2004 he has been running his business and already has had permanent clients along the thoroughfare road that he always uses. He lives with his wife and his 2 children in a ger, a Mongolian traditional nomadic yurt. 

He wants to improve his business day by day and then to have his own passenger transportation agency eventually.  His old minivan has some heavy damages and has become very old and difficult to use for his business. Recently he has purchased another one for his business. Now he needs a loan to purchase some spare parts for making repairs to his purchased minivan.

loans.use: To purchase some spare parts for making repairs to his purchased minivan.

loans.name: Bacari

texts.fr:
Monsieur Bacari est un homme marié de 52 ans et père de 3 enfants qui vit avec sa femme et ses enfants à Bougouni dans le quartier Hérémakono Nord. 
Monsieur Bacari est un diplômé en Hôtellerie restauration et excelle dans cette activité depuis maintenant 20 ans. 
Promoteur d’un établissement hôtelier au abords de la Route Nationale 7, Bacari dans la souci de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle décida de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso avec qui il est à son deuxième prêt, après avoir correctement remboursé le premier.
Avec ce nouveau prêt il compte acheter, 20 chaises, 4 tables, 10 casiers de sucreries, 10 casiers de boissons alcoolisées et biens d’autres matériels(serviettes, draps de lit et quelques douzaines de verre). Il s’approvisionne à Bamako et à Bougouni. Sa clientèle est composée essentiellement de voyageurs.
Il compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel 75.000 FCFA,qui sera utilisé pour améliorer son établissement.
texts.en:
Mister Bacari is a 52 year old married man and father to three children who lives with his wife and his children in Bougouni in the North Hérémakono district.

Mister Bacari has a diploma in hotel business catering and has excelled in this business for 20 years now.

Developer of a hotel establishment around National Road 7, Bacari wanting to better satisfy his clientèle decided to collaborate with Soro Yiriwaso with whom he is on his second loan, after having correctly repaid the first.

With this new loan he plans to buy 20 chairs, 4 tables, 10 racks of sweets, 10 racks of alcoholic beverages and other items (serviettes, bed linens and several dozen glasses). He gets his supplies in Bamako and in Bougouni. His clientèle consists essentially of travellers. 

He expects to make a monthly profit of 75,000 FCFA, which will be used to improve his establishment.

loans.use: to buy 20 chairs, 4 tables, 10 racks of sweets, 10 racks of alcoholic beverages and other items (serviettes, bed linens and several dozen glasses).

loans.name: J Amado Guillermo

texts.es:
Amado tiene 47 años de edad, es casado, tiene 2 hijos de 5 y 3 años de edad, y vive con su familia en la Colonia el paraíso, San Pedro Sula.
Don Amado tiene 20 años de dedicarse a su propia actividad de negocio que es un taller de ebanistería donde realiza toda clase de trabajos como puertas, muebles de cocina, roperos, chineros y reparación de los mismos. No tuvo dificultad en establecer este negocio ya que desde niño su padre le enseño a trabajar en madera, y desde entonces es como ha podido salir adelante dignamente con su familia, el trabaja todo el día en su negocio.
Don Amado ha logrado mantener su negocio con la ayuda de prestamos con los cuales ha podido comprar varias maquinas para el taller y surtir de materia prima, ahora solicita su segundo prestamos para la compra de materiales para elaborar muebles de cocina, chineros de madera, puertas y otros  muebles de madera.
El se siente muy agradecido por el apoyo brindado y su meta es hacer crecer su negocio y seguir invirtiendo para obtener mayores ganancias y así aportar más a su hogar.
texts.en:
Amado, age 47, is married and has two children, ages five and three.  He lives with his family in the El Paraíso neighborhood, San Pedro Sula.

For 20 years Amado has devoted himself to his business, which is a cabinetmaking shop.  He makes all types of things like doors, kitchen furniture, wardrobes, china cabinets, and he also does repairs on these items.  He did not have any difficulty establishing this business because his father taught him to work with wood when Amado was a boy.  That is how, from then on, he has been able to decently get ahead with his family.  He works all day in his business.

Amado has managed to maintain his business with the help of loans.  With that help he has been able to buy various machines for his shop and to stock raw material.  He is now requesting his second loan to buy materials to make kitchen furniture, wood china cabinets, doors, and other wood furniture.

His is very grateful for the support provided.  His goal is to make his business grow and to continue investing in order to get greater income.  That way he will contribute more to his household.

loans.use: to buy materials to make kitchen furniture, wood china cabinets, doors.

location.town: Colonia El Paraíso, San Pedro Sula.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more vita, oil, pepper, salt and rice for her business.

loans.name: Djelika

texts.fr:
Madame Djelika est une femme mariée de 30 ans et mère de 4 enfants. Elle vit avec son mari et ses enfants dans le quartier Massablacoura de Bougouni. 
N’ayant pas fréquentée l’école moderne, très vite elle commença à mener des activités génératrices de revenus. C’est ainsi qu’elle décida de suivre sa sœur pour apprendre les activités d’achat et de vente des condiments alimentaires. Avec une expérience de plus de 5 ans, elle maitrise bien cette activité et est très sollicitée et appréciée à Bougouni. Elle est à son deuxième prêt avec Soro Yiriwaso, le prêt précédent a été bien remboursé sans aucune difficulté.
Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, un carton de concentrée de tomate, 5 paquets de cube maggi, un sac de sel de cuisine et des épices. 
Elle s’approvisionne au grand marché de Bougouni et effectue sa vente au marché et  à domicile, à une clientèle composée de femmes et de quelques hommes.
Elle espère réaliser  avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 45.000 FCFA, qui servira payer le prêt et contribuer aux dépenses familiales.
texts.en:
Madam Djelika is a 30 year old married woman and mother to four children. She lives with her husband and her children in the Massablacoura district of Bougouni.

Not having gone to modern school, very quickly she began to manage income generating businesses. That's the way she decided to follow her sister to learn the business of buying and selling food condiments. With more than 5 years experience, she masters this business well and is very much in demand and appreciated in Bougouni. She is on her second loan with Soro Yiriwaso. The previous loan was well repaid without any difficulty.

She plans to use her loan to buy a carton of tomato concentrate, 5 packs of maggi cubes, a bag of cooking salt and spices.

She gets her supplies in the large market of Bougouni and sells at the market and from her home, to a clientèle consisting of women and a few men.

With this loan she hopes to make a monthly profit of 45,000 FCFA, which will be used to pay the loan and contribute to the family's expenses.

loans.use: to buy food condiments.

loans.name: Cruz Martir

texts.es: Cruz Martir de cincuenta y uno años de edad vive con su compañero de vida y sus nietos en casa propia. Ella tiene una venta de productos de uso personal cremas, perfumes, ropa entre otros, es muy conocida en la zona y se ha hecho de mucha clientela últimamente pues vende productos de excelente calidad, a precios accesibles; Cruz es una mujer carismática y muy entregada a su trabajo, piensa que para lograr un éxito duradero hay que poner mucho esfuerzo y dedicación, quiere alcanzar su sueño de ver crecer su negocio y aumentar sus ganancias para el hogar, es por eso que le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar cremas, cosméticos, perfumes, shampo, antitranspirantes, ropa etc. Cruz Martir tiene fe que así logrará darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: 51-year-old Cruz Martir lives with her life partner and grandchildren in her own home.  She has a business selling personal products such as creams, perfume and clothing.  She is very well known in her area and has built up a large customer base lately as she sells top-quality products at affordable prices.  Cruz is a charismatic woman who is very committed to her work.  She believes that, in order to achieve lasting success, you must put in a lot of effort and commitment.  Cruz would like to fulfill her dream of seeing her business grow and increase her profits for the sake of her household.  For this reason, she is requesting a loan from INTEGRAL which will allow her to buy creams, cosmetics, perfumes, shampoo, antiperspirants, clothing, etc.  Cruz Martir believes that this will enable her to provide her family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy creams, cosmetics, perfumes, shampoo, antiperspirants and clothing

loans.name: Bintirashid

texts.en:
Bintirashid is a married woman. She has seven children and all are enrolled in school. Bintirashid operates a potato-selling business and sells her goods at the market. She's worked in this business for one year. Her primary customers are the people who go to the market. 

She describes her greatest business challenge as inadequate capital to expand her business. Her highest monthly expense is food for her family. 

Bintirashid owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Bintirashid will use the KES 20,000 loan to purchase more sacks of potatoes for resale. Bintirashid aspires to establish a retail shop in the future. She joined Yehu to access funds to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase more sacks of potatoes for resale.

loans.name: Mwalima

texts.en:
Mwalima is a married woman. She has five children and all are enrolled in school. Her husband works as a casual laborer. Mwalima operates a cashew nut-selling business and sells her goods at the market. She's worked in this business for 15 years. Her primary customers are the local area residents. 

Mwalima describes her greatest business challenge as seasonality. Her highest monthly expense is food for her family. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

Mwalima will use the KES 20,000 loan to purchase more stock of cashew nuts for resale. Mwalima aspires to establish a retail shop in the future. She joined Yehu to access funds to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase more cashew nuts for resale.

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
Asha is applying for another loan to expand her existing business. She will use this 40,000 KES loan to purchase more cashew nuts for resale. In the future, Asha aspires to continue improving her business. 

Since taking her last Kiva loan, Asha has greatly improved her family’s standard of living. She hopes to continue accessing the financial services offered by Yehu and Kiva lenders and thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to purchase more cashew nuts for resale.

loans.name: Rosa De Jesús

texts.es: Rosa de Jesús de treinta y cinco años de edad vive con su compañero de vida y sus hijos. Ella posee una tienda donde vende artículos de primera necesidad arroz, frijoles, leche, huevos entre otros, su negocio es muy conocido en la localidad pues siempre está muy surtido, se ha hecho de mucha clientela pues vende a precios bajos y solo producto de primera calidad; Rosa es una mujer muy trabajadora siempre dispuesta a superarse, piensa que dentro de ella está la capacidad de manifestar todos sus deseos y así llegar al éxito, quiere ver crecer su negocio es por eso que le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar granos básicos, golosinas, especies, aceite, productos instantáneos. Rosa de Jesús  tiene la confianza que así podrá darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: 35-year-old Rosa de Jesús lives with her life partner and children.  She owns a store where she sells basic household products such as rice, beans, milk, eggs, etc.  She is very well known in her area as her store is always well stocked.  She has gained a lot of customers because she sells at low prices and only offers top-quality products.  Rosa is a very hard-working woman who is always ready to improve herself.  She believes that inside her she has the ability to realize her wishes and be successful.  She would like to see her business grow and so she is requesting a loan from INTEGRAL which will allow her to buy basic grains, candies, spices, oil and instant food products.  Rosa believes that this will enable her to provide her family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, candies, spices, oil and instant food products

loans.name: Mwanamisi

texts.en:
Mwanamisi is a married woman. She has three children and all are enrolled in school. Her husband works as a businessman. 

Mwanamisi operates a cashew nut-selling business and sells her goods at the market. She's worked in this business for one year. Her primary customers are the local area residents. She describes her greatest business challenge to be seasonality and her highest monthly expense is food for his family. 

She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Mwanamisi will use the KES 20,000 loan to purchase more cashew nuts for resale. Mwanamisi aspires to establish a vegetable grocery in the future. She joined Yehu to access funds to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase more cashew nuts for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase goats

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a tailoring business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 12000 through NWTF to purchase more materials for her tailoring business.

Fe has been in this business for seven years. Fe earns more income from her sari-sari store.

Fe has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of repairing and renovating her family's home in the future.

loans.use: To purchase more materials for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Justo Ramon

texts.es: Justo, de 42 años de edad, de oficio comerciante, se dedica a alquiler de nintendo y venta de pollo en la ciudad de León. El estuvo mas de 10 años viviendo en Costa Rica donde trabajaba en la construcción pero decidió regresar a Nicaragua para poner su negocio que es del cual vive actualmente el y su familia mantiene su  dos hijos  menores.  También cuando tiene ratos libres se dedica a trabajar en construcción siempre en busca de generar ingresos para mejorar el nivel de vida de sus hijos y brindarles un futuro mejor. El solicito el crédito para compra de juegos de video, controles y compra de pollo para vender. Uno de sus planes es comprar un vehículo para vender pollo en lo s barrios cercanos de la ciudad de Leon.
texts.en: 42-year-old Justo is a small businessman.  His business is renting out Nintendos and selling chicken in the city of León.  He lived in Costa Rica for 10 years where he worked in the building trade.  However, he decided to return to Nicaragua to set up a business.  He and his family currently live off this business (Justo provides for his two young children).  When he has any free time, Justo also works in the building trade, always looking for ways to make income so that he can improve his children's standard of living and provide them with a better future.  He requested this loan to buy video games and controllers, and also chicken to sell.  One of his plans is to buy a vehicle so that he can sell chicken in neighborhoods near the city of Leon.

loans.use: to buy video games and controllers, and chicken to sell

loans.name: Maria Victoria

texts.es:
Maria es una mujer muy dedicada y sobre todo luchadora, es casada y junto a su esposo tiene 2 maravillosos hijos, cuyas edades comprenden 10 y 13 años y ambos están cursando educación primaria, para ella son lo más importante que tiene en la vida por ello cada día se esfuerza para darle todo lo que necesitan; como buena peruana le gusta mucho por ello uno de los platos favoritos de Maria es la riquísima “carapulcra”, su esposo trabaja en una empresa de pesca pero apoya mucho a María sobre todo él es como su mano derecha y son muy unidos.

María tiene su negocio de venta de productos de aseo personal y también de tejido de sombreros, ella se levanta muy temprano todos los días para poder realizar sus quehaceres del hogar y poder dedicarse a su negocio, trabaja alrededor de 7 horas diarias y puede atender hasta 8 clientes de manera diaria, ella cree que le va bien en su negocio porque ofrece una buena atención a sus clientes y porque brinda facilidades en el pago y sobre todo calidad de productos.

Maria agradece mucho a los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a su apoyo ella podrá ampliar un poco mas su negocio y comprar  mercadería de temporada de verano como short, sandalias, entre otros, con esta mejoría ella tendrá mayor variedad de productos para ofrecer y aumentaran sus ingresos, con ello ella podrá seguir ahorrando para poder cumplir su más grande sueño:” Poder Darle un profesión a sus hijos y ser una empresaria de éxito”.
texts.en:
Maria is a very committed and tenacious woman.  She is married and, together with her husband, she has two marvelous children who are 10 and 13 years old.  They are both completing their primary education.  Her children are the most important things in Maria's life and so she works hard every day in order to provide them with everything they need.  Like all good Peruvians, Maria really enjoys Peruvian food and one of her favorite dishes is the delicious 'carapulcra' (a spicy stew).  Her husband works for a fishing company but he also supports Maria a lot.  He is her right-hand man and they are very close.

Maria has a business selling toiletries and also has a business weaving hats.  She gets up very early every day so that she can do her housework and then start working in her business.  She works around 7 hours a day and can serve up to 8 customers each day.  She believes that her business is doing well because she offers good customer service, credit facilities and, above all, because she sells good-quality products.

Maria is very grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to their support she will be able to expand her business a little further and buy summer merchandise such as shorts, sandals, etc.  This improvement will give her a larger range of products to offer her customers and she will increase her income.  This will enable her to continue saving up to achieve her biggest dream: to ensure her children have a profession and for herself to become a successful businesswoman.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise (skirts, sandals, etc.)

loans.name: Abdumalik

texts.ru: Абдумалик  кредитуется в нашей организации с 2008 года. Сам Абдумалик работает пастухом в колхозе в его отаре более сотни голов овец. Его стаж в разведении скота более 40 лет. Двое его сыновей находиться в Российской Федерации на заработке. У каждого из них есть свой дом и семьи. В прошлом году была засуха, и ему пришлось покупать корм по высокой цене. Ему приходилось доплачивать пастуху дополнительно, что бы искать корм  с водой и скот отводить в более дальние регионы. Учитывая повышения цены к весне, он решил получить кредит на скот, планирует приобрести несколько голов коз.
texts.en: Abdumalik has been granted loans in our organization since 2008. He is a herdsman on a collective farm, and his sheep flock counts over a hundred of animals.  Abdumalik has been raising livestock for over 40 years. His two sons are currently working in Russia. They both have families. Last year drought affected prices, and Abdumalik had to buy feed at a high price.  Abdumalik had also to pay extra to a shepherd because the shepherd had to travel longer distances in order to find fresh grass and water for the animals.   Taking into consideration price increase in spring, Abdumalik decided to get a loan to purchase a few goats.

loans.use: to purchase goats

loans.name: El Hadji Mamadou

texts.fr:
Monsieur El Hadji est un jeune mécanicien qui exerce ce métier depuis dix ans. Il est célibataire mais vit  avec  ses parents. Il possède un magasin de pièces détachées : donc il fait de la prestation de services  tout en vendant le matériel dont il a besoin pour son travail ; le bénéfice ne sort donc pas. 
Avec le crédit, il va acheter des pièces détachées  et  renforcer sa boutique.
Bien qu’étant célibataire, c’est lui qui s’occupe de la dépense quotidienne de sa famille.
Monsieur El Hadji a de grands projets  car il a l’intention de renouveler  ses crédits  pour  élargir son magasin  et disposer de tout ce dont aura besoin sa clientèle.
texts.en: Mr El Hadji is a young mechanic who has been working in this sector for ten years. He is single but lives with his parents. He owns a shop selling spare parts, so he does the repairs while also selling the spare parts he needs for his work. In this way, the profit stays within the business. With the proceeds of the loan, he will purchase spare parts and strengthen his shop. Although he is single, it is he who covers the family's daily expenses. Mr El Hadji has big plans, as he intends to renew his loans to extend his home and to have everything his customers could want.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for resale and also to use in his vehicle repairs

loans.name: Llanelis Nohemi

texts.es: Llanelis, es una joven de 23 años de edad, originaria de León, casada, ella se dedica  a la crianza de cerdos para vender desde hace dos años, sus padres le enseñaron acerca  de este negocio. Ella estudia farmacia en la universidad de la ciudad de León viaja desde su comarca llamada el Momotombo hasta la universidad para estudiar y ser alguien en la vida, pues gracias a este negocio ella logra pagar sus estudios, su esposo la ayuda con lo que gana trabajando paga los gastos del hogar. Ella realizo el crédito para  compra de cerdos, vitaminas y comida para alimentarlos. Pues entre mejores características y cuidos tengan sus cerdos mas lo solicitan sus clientes y le genera ingresos que le ayudan a sacar  adelante su negocio y sus estudios.
texts.en: Llanelis is a young, 23-year-old woman who was born in León.  She is married and her business is raising pigs to sell.  She has been in this business for two years and was taught by her parents.  She is studying pharmacy at university in the city of Leon.  She travels from her region, which is called Momotombo, to the university so that she can study and be someone in life.  Thanks to her business, she manages to pay for her studies.  Her husband helps her with what he earns in his work and covers their household expenses.  Llanelis requested this loan to buy pigs, vitamins and pig feed.  The more care she takes of her pigs, the more her customers request them.  This makes her income which helps her to make progress in both her business and her studies.

loans.use: to buy pigs, vitamins and pig feed
